title: Lille Model for Alcoholic Hepatitis
description: Predicts mortality in alcoholic hepatitis patients not responding to steroid therapy

parameters.name: albumin_day0
parameters.description: Serum albumin level at day 0 (start of steroid therapy) in g/L

parameters.name: bilirubin_day0
parameters.description: Total bilirubin at day 0 (start of steroid therapy) in µmol/L

parameters.name: bilirubin_day7
parameters.description: Total bilirubin at day 7 of steroid therapy in µmol/L

result.name: lille_score
result.description: Lille Model score for alcoholic hepatitis prognosis

ranges.interpretation: Lille score <0.45 indicates good response to steroid therapy with 6-month survival of 85%. Continue corticosteroid treatment and supportive care.

Lille score ≥0.45 indicates poor response to steroid therapy with 6-month survival of 25%. Consider discontinuing corticosteroids and evaluate for alternative therapies including liver transplantation.

references: Louvet A, Naveau S, Abdelnour M, Ramond MJ, Diaz E, Fartoux L, et al. The Lille model: a new tool for therapeutic strategy in patients with severe alcoholic hepatitis treated with steroids. Hepatology. 2007 Jun;45(6):1348-54. doi: 10.1002/hep.21607.

Mathurin P, O'Grady J, Carithers RL, Phillips M, Louvet A, Mendenhall CL, et al. Corticosteroids improve short-term survival in patients with severe alcoholic hepatitis: a meta-analysis of individual patient data. Gut. 2011 Feb;60(2):255-60. doi: 10.1136/gut.2010.224097.
Dhanda AD, Collins PL, McCune CA. Is liver transplantation required after severe alcoholic hepatitis? Curr Opin Crit Care. 2018 Apr;24(2):141-149. doi: 10.1097/MCC.0000000000000492.
formula: Lille Score = exp(-R)/(1 + exp(-R)) where R = 3.19 - 0.101×age + 0.147×albumin + 0.0165×(bilirubin_day7 - bilirubin_day0) - 0.206×renal_insufficiency - 0.0065×bilirubin_day0 - 0.0096×prothrombin_time. Renal insufficiency = 1 if creatinine >1.3 mg/dL, otherwise 0.
notes: Developed from 295 patients with severe alcoholic hepatitis treated with prednisolone
Cutoff of 0.45 identifies 75.6% of deaths with 6-month survival: <0.45 = 85%, ≥0.45 = 25%
Can be calculated at day 4 with similar accuracy (early Lille model)
Helps identify patients for early liver transplant evaluation
Steroid non-responders have increased infection risk with continued therapy
